remarks: Conjoin the statements of ~ dvfsumrlim and ~ dvfsumrlim2 .  (This is useful as a target for lemmas, because the hypotheses to this theorem are complex, and we don't want to repeat ourselves.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-May-2016.)
statement:
dvfsum.s $e |- S = ( T (,) +oo ) $.
dvfsum.z $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
dvfsum.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
dvfsum.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. RR ) $.
dvfsum.md $e |- ( ph -> M <_ ( D + 1 ) ) $.
dvfsum.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. RR ) $.
dvfsum.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. S ) -> A e. RR ) $.
dvfsum.b1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. S ) -> B e. V ) $.
dvfsum.b2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. Z ) -> B e. RR ) $.
dvfsum.b3 $e |- ( ph -> ( RR _D ( x e. S |-> A ) ) = ( x e. S |-> B ) ) $.
dvfsum.c $e |- ( x = k -> B = C ) $.
dvfsumrlim.l $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ k e. S ) /\ ( D <_ x /\ x <_ k ) ) -> C <_ B ) $.
dvfsumrlim.g $e |- G = ( x e. S |-> ( sum_ k e. ( M ... ( |_ ` x ) ) C - A ) ) $.
dvfsumrlim.k $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. S |-> B ) ~~>r 0 ) $.
dvfsumrlim3.1 $e |- ( x = X -> B = E ) $.
dvfsumrlim3 $p |- ( ph -> ( G : S --> RR /\ G e. dom ~~>r /\ ( ( G ~~>r L /\ X e. S /\ D <_ X ) -> ( abs ` ( ( G ` X ) - L ) ) <_ E ) ) ) $.
$d B k $.
$d C x $.
$d D k x $.
$d E x $.
$d M k x $.
$d S k x $.
$d T x $.
$d X k x $.
$d Z x $.
$d k ph x $.
